summary: This document is a chain of emails from October 2023 between FBI personnel in the Child Exploitation Notification Program (CENP) and a Special Agent regarding a victim's claim that her childhood and adult photographs were in the possession of Jeffrey Epstein and David Boies. The emails discuss coordinating a response to the victim's plea for help in recovering the images.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned by a victim as being in possession of her photographs, both from when she was a child and as an adult.

persons.name: David Boies
persons.context: Mentioned by a victim as being in possession of her photographs, with his unique vehicle identifiable in the adult photos.

connections.description: Implied connection via the victim's claim that photographs of her were in the possession of both men.

events.title: Victim's Email to FBI CPVA
events.description: An individual emails the FBI's Child Pornography Victim Assistance program, alleging that photographs of her from age ten and as an adult were in the possession of Jeffrey Epstein and David Boies, and pleading for help to recover them.

events.title: FBI Internal Coordination on Victim Claim
events.description: An FBI Special Agent, copied on the victim's email, states they worked the Jeffrey Epstein case but never dealt with any pictures, and forwards the matter to case agents.

events.title: FBI Scheduling Call on Victim Case
events.description: FBI personnel from the Victim Services Division and a Special Agent coordinate via email to schedule a call to discuss how to proceed with the victim's claim about photographs.

keyFacts: In October 2023, a victim contacted the FBI claiming photographs of her from age ten and as an adult were in the possession of Jeffrey Epstein and attorney David Boies.
The victim described Boies's vehicle with a tan interior as being visible in the adult photographs.
The victim stated an investigation was open with the New Mexico Attorney General's office regarding the matter.
An FBI Special Agent involved in the Epstein case was consulted but stated they had not dealt with any pictures, prompting internal coordination on how to respond.
The email chain shows the FBI's Child Exploitation Notification Program (formerly CPVA) actively managing a new victim allegation years after Epstein's death.
